definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: He was found guilty by the court-martial and sentenced to imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 军事法庭判他有罪并判他坐牢。

sentences.english: God rejects the requests of those who sinfully despise the Savior.
sentences.chinese: 上帝拒绝那些有罪地蔑视救主的人的要求。

sentences.english: The fingerprints found on the gun were used to convict her.
sentences.chinese: 枪上发现的指纹被用来判明她有罪。

sentences.english: He had made up his mind that Johnson was guilty, and he steamrollered anyone who disagree with him.
sentences.chinese: 他已经认定约翰逊有罪，并迫使任何持异议者就范。

sentences.english: And how many would vote 'guilty', what they did was morally wrong?
sentences.chinese: 多少会投“有罪“，认为道德上是不允许的？

sentences.english: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.
sentences.chinese: 主不算为有罪的，这人是有福的。

sentences.english: If she were rubbing the ends of the stalks, she would be guilty of threshing .
sentences.chinese: 如果她被搓完的秸秆，她将是有罪的脱粒。

sentences.english: Of course Do-jun could be guilty and Jin-tae had no involvement.
sentences.chinese: 当然东俊也许确实有罪而金泰与罪案毫无关联。

sentences.english: They pronounced guilty every one of the accused.
sentences.chinese: 他们宣布每个被指控的人有罪。

sentences.english: If convicted, Benaissa faces between six months and 10 years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 如被判有罪，贝奈萨将面临6个月到10年的监禁。

sentences.english: The hearing didn't last long. "Guilty, " the magistrate said.
sentences.chinese: 听讼没有持续很长时间，“有罪”检察官说到。

sentences.english: If any person be found guilty, he has the right of appeal.
sentences.chinese: 任何被认为有罪的人都有上诉权。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and convicted to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被判有罪，并被处死刑。

sentences.english: One who condones evils is just as guilty as the one who perpetrates it.
sentences.chinese: 宽恕邪恶和制造邪恶的人一样有罪。

sentences.english: Both teenagers pled guilty and were ordered to pay for the damage.
sentences.chinese: 两个青少年都被判有罪，并被责令赔偿损失。

sentences.english: On the basis of the evidence we deduce that he is guilty.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些证据，我们推论他是有罪的。

definition: to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
